casebody.data:
William V. HUDSON, Appellant, v. William H. HIATT, Warden, United States Penitentiary, Atlanta, Georgia, Appellee. No. 12624. United States Court of Appeals Fifth Circuit. May 9, 1949. William V. Hudson, of Atlanta, Ga., in pro. per., for appellant. J. Ellis Mundy, U. S. Atty., and Harvey H. Tisinger, Asst. U. S. Atty., both of Atlanta, Ga., for appellee.

Before HOLMES, McCORD, and WALLER, Circuit Judges.

PER CURIAM.

The judgment of the lower Court must be affirmed because of the failure of the petitioner to comply with Sec. 2255, Title 28 U.S.C.A.1 Moreover, we find no reversible error in the case otherwise.

Judgment is affirmed.
